#summary VDD Archive Format

= Introduction =

VDD is a container format that is only used in Puyo Puyo Box.

*Files inside the archive must be stored at an offset that is divisible by 2048. The file size of the archive must be divisible by 2048.*

== Header ==
0x00 - 0x03
 (4 bytes) Number of files in the AFS archive.

== Filename, File Offsets & Length (starting at 0x08) ==
This is repeated for the number of files in the archive.

0x00 - 0x0F
 (16 bytes) Filename of the file

0x10 - 0x13
 (4 bytes) Offset of the file in the archive divided by 2048.

0x14 - 0x17
 (4 bytes) Size of the file in the archive.
